fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4879].
  {panel}

*Summary*

At the moment, when the customer set the CC field with the mail handler it creates a new ticket in Service Desk.

*Suggestion*

Make it configurable to create issues only when the "to" field is filled.
For example, CCing "support@asdf.com" should NOT raise a ticket, while sending mail "To" that address should raise a ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to create issues only when the "to" field is filled  in mail handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4878].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When an issue is replied to by an agent, we would like to be able to get  a count so we can generate a report that can be used to get an average of how many replies are needed to resolve an issue.

h5. Existing Feature:

None as JIRA Service Desk does not have a feature that allows counting of replies.

h5. Suggestion

A counter can be provided to check either how many comments are added to each issue by an agent or how many times an issue transitioned to {{Waiting For Customer}} or other public transitions that lets the customer see the changes.
This can then be recorded in a field and used to generate a report.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Count Amount of Times Responded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4877].
  {panel}

Hi!

We are developing an Outlook app for JIRA and we allow our customers to create ServiceDesk requests on behalf of customers from Outlook. We also support to provide additional fields, which will be available on the resulting issue, by updating it afterwards.

To render the mask correctly, we need the RequestType to IssueType mapping, which is unfortunately not available via the public API currently. We are using the following call as of now, but we are not sure how long this will continue to work:

/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/[key]/groups/[id]/request-types

for example: [https://yasoon.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/bs/groups/8/request-types]

Would it be possible to add the issueType to the following call?:
/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/[id]/requesttype

Thanks!
Tobi
fields.summary: Return the IssueType for a Request Type
EMAIL CAMPAIGN SHOULD BE DONE.
Add REST support for setting Organization on a ticket - Cloud
As an Agent, I would like to make the time units in Service Desk reporting configurable.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4873].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a JIRA Core or JIRA Software user who has been added to the *Service Desk Team* role in a Service Desk Project, I can collaborate on Service Desk Requests.

However, I am not able to use the Organization-related JQL functions in the Issue Filter to search for requests. If I attempt to use the {{organizationMembers()}} function, I receive the error:
{quote}You must be an agent to use the Customer Organization JQL functions.
{quote}
If I attempt to perform a search using the *Organizations* field, I receive the error:
{quote}You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.
{quote}
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Expose the Organization JQL tools to Service Desk Collaborators
h3. Why this is important

Companies may want to use Organizations to organize their Customers but not want to make all the Developers full-fledged Service Desk Agents in order to make it possible to sort Requests by Organization.
h3. Workaround

One option is to update the *Application access* so that the Collaborators take up a Service Desk license and are instead Service Desk Agents.

Another approach may be to use an add-on to implement a post function to copy the Organization to another Custom Field.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Collaborator I want to be able to use Customer Organization JQL functions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4872].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When creating a ticket through email, all members of the organization are added by default.  This causes notifications for people in the organization, who the reporter may not wish to be included.

h3. Suggested Solutions

Create a project level default setting to specify whether email notifications are shared with the organization or made private.

h3. User level Solution
On a per-customer basis, there should be the following options:
# use the project default
# notify all members
# notify only reporter
# notify specific members [list]
# notify all members except: [list]

h3. Workaround

See additional feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4543 for disabling all notifications, except Reporter.
fields.summary: Ability to choose a default setting for Organization sharing when ticket created by email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4870].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Existing documentation [Serving customers with a knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html] helps customers to set up the knowledge base but it doesn't explain how it is expected to work for both Agents and Customers.

For example, how does a related knowledge base article suggested to Agent when they are working on a ticket?

h3. Suggestion
Provide more details on how it works behind the scene to help admins and agents to verify whether the functionality is working as expected or what are the best practices

For example, how to write a Knowledge Base title to increase the visibility of the article so that Agent and Customer will be able to find the right article
fields.summary: Documentation for details about knowledge base and how it works in Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4869].
  {panel}

I am using Service Desk 3.2.6

I will add my company holidays to Service Desk Calendar. These holidays vary from different regions, as my company works in different regions.

Here in the attached calendar, I am unable to Sort dates.

!image-2017-03-01-12-53-58-029.png!
fields.summary: Need ability to sort Calendar dates in Service Desk SLA section

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4868].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In a Service Desk project, when *Who can customers share requests with?* is set to *Any customer, by typing an email address*, customer need to type the email address with exactly the same case as stored in JIRA in order to share with that customer.

h3. Environment
* JSD 3.3.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create two SD customer : customerA and customerB with email address "tEStAccount@localhost.com"
# Make sure the *Customer permissions* has been set as following:
 !2017-02-28_customer-permissions.png|thumbnail! 
# Login to customer portal with customerA and raise a new ticket.
# Try to share the ticket with customerB by entering the email address (in lower case) "testaccount@localhost.com"

h3. Expected Results
customerB is added as request participant of the ticket

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown :
 !2017-02-28_share-error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* If customerA enters the email address with the exact case, then customerB can be added as request participant without any problem.
* This issue cannot be reproduced in a JSD 3.2 instance.

h3.Workaround
Set *Who can customers share requests with?* to *Any customer or organization, by searching in this project* so that when user types email address JSD will auto-complete the input.
fields.summary: Email address becomes case sensitive when sharing ticket with other customer since JSD 3.3.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for {*}JIRA Service Desk Cloud{*}. Using {*}JIRA Service Desk Server{*}? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4867].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update – 8 November 2021}
Hey all, 

Quick update on this feature. It is still on our Customer Management roadmap, but a couple of the precursory projects are taking longer than originally anticipated. I will aim to update again during Q3/Q4 planning (January 2021 / April 2021). 

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we can manage Service Desk customer list by adding user group into the Service Desk project's {{SERVICE DESK CUSTOMERS}} role.

But to manage customers on the Organization level, we will need to add user one by one which is not an efficient way of maintaining the list when there is a huge change in the company's user management.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Service Desk's Organization to accept user groups.
fields.summary: Allow user groups to be added into Service Management organization
Ability to Automatically Add Customer's Name to Reporter's Profile Info
Improve automation rules to send notifications based on satisfaction scores.
Participants
Option to add new customers to an organization automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4861].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customers using the "Forgot your password?" link from the Customer Portal receive an email that looks like it is using Service Desk Notifications as the template, that is, using this text in the footer:{quote}Help Center sent you this message, powered by JIRA Service Desk{quote}

However, these do not appear to be customizable like notifications for a specific Service Desk are. 

I refer to the password email specifically because it's the first example I found.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customization of the templates for the password recovery email the same way notifications for an individual Service Desk can be customized. 

h3. Why this is important
When modifying templates to include branding for Service Desk notifications, it would be preferable to have that be uniformly applied including to the password recovery email.
fields.summary: Allow customization to notifications not specific to a specific Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4859].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no option to disable issue creation via JIRA but able to create via Customer Portal
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the option to create issue via JIRA or Customer Portal or both. 
h3. Workaround

Configure *Create Issue* permission only for *Service Desk Customer - Portal Only* . But , do note that JIRA will throw below error :-

!Screen Shot 2017-02-24 at 9.27.09 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to disable Create Issue from JIRA , but able to raise via Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4858].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA Service Desk report, customer can change the report period for *Satisfaction* report (see screenshot below) :
 !2017-02-24_satisfaction-report.png|thumbnail! 
But not for *SLA goals* report (see screenshot below) :
 !2017-02-24_sla-report.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
All an option for *SLA goals* report which allows user to change report period as for *Satisfaction* report.
fields.summary: Allow customisation of report period for "SLA goals" report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4857].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, for newly created Service Desk project by default the Customer Permission setting is set to *Customers who have an account on this JIRA site*. This raised security concern from customer end-users. Some users belongs to an old user group claimed that there a risk their ticket details was exposed to another user groups.

h3. Suggested Solution

Set *Customers who are added to the project* as default settings for newly created Service Desk project.

h3. Why this is important
Security concern.
fields.summary: Set default Customer Permission for newly created project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4856].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on JSD-1316 ticket , instead of Captcha, we implemented the honeypot technique to prevent spam bots from creating accounts on the customer portal . And this information should be updated in [Enabling public signup and CAPTCHA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/enabling-public-signup-780861551.html] .

h3. Suggested Solution

Update the [Enabling public signup and CAPTCHA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/enabling-public-signup-780861551.html] documentation about honeypot technique.

h3. Why this is important
The information currently is confusing to the customer . So , it will be better to provide the detail information.
fields.summary: Update "Enabling public signup and CAPTCHA" documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4855].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When searching a customer from Project's Customers list, you will need to enter the start of the _name_ as a search string. Searching a string of any portion of the mail/name is not working.

Eg. If a customer has an email address test@atlassian.com; searching _est_ will not work but searching _tes_ will work.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve search on Project's Customers list, like the searching functionality in User Management > Users or User Management > Portal Only
fields.summary: Improve search on Project's Customers list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4853].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When attempting to create a JIRA service desk project the creation fails and users receive the following error:

"Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again."

h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.940.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the name of any issue type that's used by service desk and already exists.
# e.g: Change the 'Sub-task' issue type name to 'Sub-Task'
# Try to create a service desk project

h3. Expected Results
The project should be created.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:

{code}
2017-02-23 13:24:54.187883500 2017-02-23 13:24:54,127 http-nio-2993-exec-23 ERROR sysadmin 804x11495x1  104.192.142.137 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.j.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl.privacy-safe] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187885500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: An issue type with the name 'Sub-task' exists already.

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187886500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:130)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187928500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:160)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187929500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:93)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187929500 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187935500 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187935500 ... 1 filtered
{code}

h3. Notes
This only happens when you're trying to create your first project.

h3. Workaround
 - Change the issue type that was modified, changing the name back to default.
fields.summary: Unable to create project in Jira Service Desk due to incorrect issue type name.
Improvement suggestion of JSD-87 - Email Notifications for missed Goals and other SLA events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4851].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
The *Request Created* email from Service Desk has the Project name as the sender's name.
 !email.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Allow the Sender's name to be configured. For example, a generic name like "JIRA Support Team"

h3. Why is it important
To standardize the email format
fields.summary: The Request Created email shouldn't use the Project name as the sender's name
Display date and time on Service Desk queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4849].
  {panel}

+Consider the following scenario:+

Comment validator is used during transition. I wanted this to ensure that a comment was made before status was changed but there is a possibility they would have already made the comment before changing the status so then this popup would be annoying (as they had already done it) 

+Suggestion+

Is there a way for a popup to happen on a status click/transition click that just is an extra prompt for example - "Please ensure you have added a comment" and then they just have to press OK to move on?
fields.summary: Custom Pop-up on Transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4848].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Disabled users are not able to raise request in Service Desk.

Disabled users should be able to create a request using the mail handler, for example to reactive their account.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow disabled user to raise a request

h3. Workaround
The disabled user needs to raise a request using a new email address.
fields.summary: Allow disabled user to raise a request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4847].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently , JSD will create issue regardless the email subject .

h3. Suggested Solution

When email subject, sender, and email content is the same , new issue will not be created. 

h3. Why this is important
To prevent spam issue.
fields.summary: Create issue via email enhancement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4846].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As per current, notification can't be control by time based on working hour or non working hour. It will be great if the notification will be different during non working hour.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give option for admin to configure different notification template based on time.

h3. Why this is important

More friendly reminder to the customer that create during non working hour.
fields.summary: As admin, would like to configure notification based on time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4845].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

I am set *Email from* setting to be without exact name, and be always the same (for example, +MCC RU - IT SUPPORT+). 

Usual notifications JIRA turned off in project. But customer notifications turned on (we like it for easy template editor)

But customer's notifications receiving with fullname of the operator, who make action.

How can i hide operator name?
JIRA SD 3.3.0

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk project.
# Go to {{Admin > System > General Configuration}} page.
# Click *Edit Settings*.
# In the *Email from* field, change the option to something else e.g 
{code}
{email}, {email.hostname}, (Some Text)
{code}

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA Service Desk would use this setting when it sends out notifications to customers.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA Service Desk seems to use the username of the person who performed the change whereas JIRA projects respect the change.

h5. Observation

As JIRA Service Desk notification is different from the normal one used by JIRA, could this be because this is hard-coded and this is the expected behavior?
fields.summary: Email From setting doesnt work with customer notifications
Approvals are not deleted from the database when the issue is deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4842].
  {panel}

Our business would benefit greatly by having automation rules for organizations on all 'if' conditions like Comment Added, Issue Created, Status Changed etc.

ie. Alert Organization

Or alternatively an automation rule that allows for Users and Organizations to be added as watchers.

This is essential because many of the Service Desk requests we receive require notice to other organizations within the company. While users can add them manually, there is human error and once an organization is added, unless members add themselves as participants, no further notifications are sent.
fields.summary: Automation Rules for Organizations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4841].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
The documentation shows how to add/remove Organizations and add/remove Customers to/from the Organizations. However, there's no context on how this feature can be useful in a practical way.

h3. Suggestion
* provide some use cases on how this feature works or how it helps us to manage the customers and organizations
fields.summary: Review Manage Customers and Organizations documentation
Automatically link Confluence Articles to Service Desk Requests when Confluence Pages are made through a Service Desk Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4838].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when removing *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* for *Add Comments* permission will prompt below error:-

  !Screen Shot 2017-02-20 at 17.28.05_1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to disable comment for customer and remove the pop up error.
fields.summary: Ability to disable "Comment" for customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4835].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the only gadget that supports satisfaction fields is the filter results gadget.  Some users would like to be able to build pie charts from satisfaction data to see what percentage of responses are 1, 2, 3, etc stars.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the satisfaction field available as a value like other fields in gadget configuration so it can be selected and used for pie charts and other gadgets.
fields.summary: Make satisfaction values accessible to JIRA gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4834].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

We would like to see the search terms our clients using to fine tune & optimize the request types and their keywords.

h3. Suggested Solution

Log the searches entered by the customers prior to opening a ticket and have those accessible to the admins/agents.
fields.summary: Analytics data for the search terms entered and selected request types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4803].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when a request is created, the request will only show the request type icon and would not display the request type name. Without a request name, users tend to confuse to what kind of request type typically when an approval is required.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the request name together with the request type icon.
h3. Why this is important
Avoid confusion on request types required for a user to approve.
fields.summary: Option to display Request Name in portal request view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4800].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
External System import does not provide an option for [Manage Engine|https://www.manageengine.com/products/service-desk/help/adminguide/]
h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA Service desk should have more specific import options for customers coming from other similar help desk software. 
h3. Why this is important
Less of a pain point for customers to migrate to JIRA Service Desk from other solutions. 

 
h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Manage Engine Import option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4799].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently reporting functionality of the [CSAT | https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/collecting-customer-satisfaction-csat-feedback-790791332.html] is limited to the default reports:
* Article usage
* Article effectiveness 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice to be able to add in query-able fields for the data that could be added to a saved filter and used in existing JIRA gadgets such as Pie Charts for a wider range of Reporting functionality.

 
h3. Workaround
In some versions of Service desk the EXPERIMENTAL and internal only API end-points can be accessed as described in the workaround for the following Feature request:
- [Add the possibility to get service desk reports using REST API | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3815]

*NOTE:* this is not an optimal solution since this is only used internally and it may change without notice.
fields.summary: CSAT JQL so the data can be added to existing Gadgets
Allow user to add Organizations to issues in another JIRA projects (outside JSD)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4796].
  {panel}

If a JSD agent is working on a ticket for a customer and goes to their address bar to send the link to a customer, it'll be jira.example.com/browse/JSDPROJECT-123

If a JSD customer goes to this link, they're given a giant warning as they should be using jira.example.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/X/JSDPROJECT-123 which an agent needs to get by going to the "View Customer Request" link on the RHS

 

It would be IDEAL if the agent link was used by a customer, that it checked if the user was a legitimate customer for that request and redirected them to the customer request view automatically.

 

Obviously if the user did not have access to JSDPROJECT-123, then throw the same error.
fields.summary: Automatically redirect JSD customer to customer portal link if agent link is used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4794].
  {panel}

Currently it is not possible to use create a subdomain, f.e support.example.com and link this subdomain to the service desk url https://www.example.com/jira/servicedesk/customer/key. 

h3. Workaround

Use a Reverse Proxy or URL redirect service external from JIRA.

Another workaround is described in [How to customize customer portal URL in JIRA Service Desk Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-customize-customer-portal-url-in-jira-service-desk-server-847755218.html]
 * _Please ensure you test this first on your test instance before you implement on your production._
 * _Please also note that Atlassian does not support this customization._
fields.summary: Make it possible to use service desk in combination with subdomains

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4793].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the Customer portal homepage only shows *Popular* and *Recent* projects. This may confuse some users on where to find some other projects that are not shown at *Popular* and *Recent* projects.

Customer portal homepage URL is {{<Base URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals}}.

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of having *Popular* and *Recent* projects, Customer portal homepage should display all the Projects that the customer has the apporpriate permissions.
fields.summary: Customer portal homepage should show all the projects by default
Adding expense claims access to and employee in timesheets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4791].
  {panel}

Hi,

it would be great if it was possible to provide the author user of a comment via the REST API. It's currently possible to raise an issue on behalf of another user (even just an email address), so it would be good, if follow-up responses could also be added as comments from that user.

It would probably be enough to just extend the existing comment service to allow to provide an author.

Thanks,
Tobias
fields.summary: Allow onBehalfOf for Comments via REST API

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently , JSD will create issue automatically once an email is send to the configured incoming email regardless the sender.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a white list of sender to be filter out from issue creation.
fields.summary: Ability to filter by email for issue creation via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4787].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is no clear distinction of Cloud and Server in the REST API documentations of https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/ and https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/. The only difference is the URL and the version. This lack of clarify may cause confusion for customers especially when both have the same description but totally different API resources.

h3. Suggestion
Provide clearer description highlighting the version and platform the documentation is for
fields.summary: Improve REST API documentation
Allow for the creation of templates for Request Forms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4784].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
At the moment, reporters of a request can freely remove any request participants in their requests. There isn't any configuration to disable this.

h3. Suggestion 
Create an option for admins to choose whether to allow customers to remove participants.
fields.summary: Configuration to allow/deny customers to remove participants

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4782].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the variables available for customising email templates are limited to the list below:
* For the email content
 !2017-02-15_variables.png|thumbnail! 
* For the email subject
 !2017-03-31_mail-subject-variables.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add more variables like date, organisation, priority, component, custom fields, reporter name etc. so that customer can have a choice among different fields to show in an email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4780].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

 
 {color:#333333}Currently, in the Customer notifications setting, the default rules has the selection of "Reporter(customer)" and "Customer involved"  in {color}the *To* field, except some rules, such as "Organization added" rule. 

!Screen Shot 2017-02-15 at 14.33.01.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Adding the feature to select the recipients of Organisation group in the To field. 
h3. Workaround

Nothing in particular.
fields.summary: Selection of Organization for the recipients in the Customer notifications.
Satisfaction Area
Make the width of fields on a Service Desk form configurable.
Display approval buttons in the email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4774].
  {panel}

Hi!

We have problems with customers access to tickets, which we have created in their name.

How can we gain view and interacting right to these users ?

Not the agents view, just the customer portal way.

 

We tried to set them as reporter, which did not work. Also we tried to set them as applicant, which did not work too :(

They still don't receive any mails from comments. Also they are not able to see these tickets in their portal.

 

Is someone able to help us please ?

 

Greetings,

Ricardo
fields.summary: Allow Users to view and comment
Automation rules to work with remote issue links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4772].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After upgrading to JSD 3.3.0, a pop-up window which should allow users to click on a "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions does not work with error as shown in screenshot below. 
 !automation.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* The affected project workflow has legacy transitions. To identify this, please follow the *Resolution: Check your JIRA Service Desk project workflow properties* as outlined in [this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-this-service-project-may-not-work-as-expected-error-777027034.html#HowtofixThisserviceprojectmaynotworkasexpectederror-CheckyourJIRAServiceDeskprojectworkflowproperties].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance with JSD 2.3.6, create a JSD project and make sure there are legacy transitions in the project's workflow.
# Upgrade the instance to JSD 3.0.0.
# Upgrade the instance to JSD 3.3.0.
# Create an Automation rule to transition on comment (the default one).

h3. Expected Results
An "Automation is the future" message will appear and users should be able to click on the "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions.

h3. Actual Results
* An "Automation is the future" message will appear but when users click on the "Migrate Now" link, an error occurs (see screenshot) and the "Automation is the future" message continue to appear from time to time.
* In the *Network* tab of the browser developer tool, there will be a PUT request send to site URL like {{http://localhost:8080/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/disableLegacyTransition/1}} with status code 404, which means not found.

h3.Workaround
# Identify the transition ID from the last part of the URL of the request.
#* For example, *ID = 1* for {{http://localhost:8080/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/disableLegacyTransition/1}}
# Update via database with the SQL query below.
#* {code:SQL}update "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" set "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED"='t' where "ID" = 1;{code}
#* If only _int_ is allowed for the "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED" column {code:SQL}update "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" set "LEGACY_TRANSITION_DISABLED"=1 where "ID" = 1;{code}
# Restart JIRA.
(i) Always back up your data before performing any modification to the database. If possible, try your modifications on a test server.
fields.summary: The "Migrate Now" link to disable legacy transitions is not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4770].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, *Organization* is not on the list for *Statistic Type* option.

h3. Suggested Solution

Insert *Organization* field in the list.

h3. Why this is important
Customer can monitor Issue Statistic based on *Organization*
fields.summary: Add "Organization" field on "Statistic Type" option for Issue Statistic gadget
Organizations are counting tickets based in the reporter and not in the Organizations field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4767].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JSD will create issue via email based on "Deleted" and "Seen" flags set to false and were received after your email account and service desk project were linked.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add one more option, which JSD will create the issue based on keywords/phrases from email subject

h3. Why this is important
 This will provide customer more option to configure issue create via email.
fields.summary: Allow to configure request via email based on keywords/phrases from email subject

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4766].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Cannot migrate from server to cloud because the minimum required version is 3.0.0, but the backup file is exported from Service Desk 3.2.0. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade to Service Desk 2.5.9 to 3.2.0
 # Backup data
 # Import backup file to cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Import data successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Cannot import data and received this message:
{panel}
We can't complete your upgrade. It looks like the data you are trying to import is from an earlier version of JIRA Service Desk. You need to upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.0 first, then export new data and try again. Read these upgrade notes for instructions: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/server_jira+jsd_upgrade]
{panel}
h3.
fields.summary: Cannot import Jira backup into Cloud because of wrong version in backup file

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4764].
  {panel}

It's a bit cumbersome to add a new customer from service desk. You can add an email address, but not set the user's full name.

Once the email is added, we then have to go into jira users admin, edit the user, and then set the name on a separate screen. It would be great to be able to do this in one shot.

I usually copy and paste names/addresses from my email client, and the generic standard for names and addresses is: First Last <name@company.com>.

It would be great to be able to paste this in as one unit right into service desk to add the user and set the name.

 

It should also be able to parse

'First Last' <name@company.com>

"First Last" <name@company.com>

 

And also, all these combinations, using: Last, First

 

Ideally there would also be a plugin hook where there can be the ability to add to these rules or replace them with the administrators choice of functionality.
fields.summary: Ability to specify user's full name when adding to jira service desk customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4763].
  {panel}

Things like Workflow Scheme, Issue Type Scheme and etc are great for reducing work on maintaining several projects with the same behaviour. Please add support for Schemes on Service Desk's:

* Request Types
* SLA
* Automation

h3. Problem Definition
Starting from JSD 3.2 there is a new feature which allows user to create sample project. However when creating a sample project, JSD will also create several demo users (with email address @example.com). These users are created without notifying the administrator which could be seen as a security breach by mistake.

h3. Suggested Solution
Alert administrator about these demo users when creating the sample project.

h3. Problem
There's no field validation functionality for request created by Customers from the Customer Portal. For example, if there's a field for Customers to insert their License number, there's no validation for the License number validity.

h3. Suggestion
Admin should be able to create fields with validation or functionality like the SEN field on the Create Request form in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com].

To ensure that the data entered by the Customers is sensible and reasonable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4743].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Webhook based on JQL does not trigger when SLA fields are used and the event set to fire the Webhook is the Issue creation event.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# Set a webhook based in JQL like this:
{code}
"Time to first response" = withinCalendarHours() and project = XYZ.
{code}
Set so the webhook will be triggered in the creation issue event.

h3. Expected Results
The webhook is fired when an issue is created in the service desk if during the working hours in the calendar applied.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is never fired.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround, but the user may try to manipulate the date of issue creation in the JQL to meet its criteria:
{code}
created > date and created < date
{code}
fields.summary: Webhook based on JQL does not trigger when SLA fields are used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4742].
  {panel}

We have one JSD project for submitting to our team and the 20 products we support. Currently, we have 40 groups that the request types are organized into.  Feedback has been that finding the request could be easier to manage. 

Looking at Atlassian's Website, the support.Atlassian.com is acting as a landing page and directs teams to the correct service desk.   Thanking along this same approach, we would like to have multiple levels for organizing request types.

*Current behavior of JSD 7.2.x:*
 * Project
 ** Group
 *** Request Type

 

*Desired Behavior* 
 * Project
 ** Catagory
 *** Group
 **** Request Type

 

*Example* 
 * Atlassian Support Team (Project) 
 ** JIRA (Catagory) 
 *** JIRA - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Project (Request Type) 
 **** Create New Group (Request Type) 
 **** Add User to Group (Request Type) 
 *** JIRA - Project Customization Request (Group)
 **** Create New Workflow (Request Type) 
 **** Edit Workflow (Request Type) 
 **** Add/remove Fields to Screen (Request Type) 
 ** Confluence
 *** Conflunce - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Project (Request Type) 
 **** Create New Group (Request Type) 
 **** Add User to Group (Request Type) 
 *** Confluence - Project Customization Request (Group)
 **** Add Plugin (Request Type) 
 ** HipChat

 *** HipChat - Standard Requests (Group)
 **** Create New Room (Request Type) 
 **** Add Integration to Room (Request Type)
fields.summary: Enable Multi-level organization of Request Types groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4741].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, the Satisfaction Survey is only available for JIRA Service Desk Notification at Resolved Notification. But, such feature could be needed for other Project Type in which the Context of the Feedback could different and there is such scenario where the Service Desk project would need to use JIRA Standard Notification.

h3. Problem Solution:
To have this feature to be available for all project types and notification when JIRA Service Desk Application is installed in the instance.

h3. Why is it needed:
* To make the feature is available for other project types that need the feature as well.
* At such, it will help a third-party integration of email notification.
fields.summary: Satisfaction Survey for Standard JIRA Notification
Regarding Rest Api

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4737].
  {panel}

h3. Description of problem

Custom field has global context and additional context with different options. Additional context is set for JSD project.

JSD search fields allow custom field to be selected and present options for global context. Does not show options configured in additional context tied to JSD project.

Reproduced in:
 * Server 3.3.0
 * Cloud v3.3.0-OD-1000.846.0 / JIRA v1000.718.6

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create JSD project
 # Create new checkbox custom field with "Global" value, add to JSD project screens.
 # Create new context for custom field, associate with JSD project. Add value "JSDvalue"
 # Attempt to add field to JSD project queue, automation, or reports
 ** For example, create new queue and in basic "Issues to show" select the new field and try to select value.

h3. Experienced behavior
Custom field presents options tied to global context. These are the incorrect options.
 * Does not show options tied to JSD project context.

h3. Expected behavior
JSD shows correct values in basic search dropdown.
 * These would be the options set for the context tied to the JSD project.

h3. Workaround
Use the advanced search option to configure the report, queue, or automation rule.

h3. Additional notes
Request types work properly, showing the options from the project specific context and no options from global context.
 * The portal presents the correct options
 * When hiding field the default option selection shows correct options
fields.summary: Basic search in JSD shows incorrect options when custom field restricted by project context
Forgot your password form on customer portal doesn't send automatic mail (not sure if bug or configuration)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4735].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, even if the email notification and email request is configured to a specific email, invitation email still comes from default SMTP server
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the email address for invitation email be configured
h3. Why this is important
Avoid customer confusion as email addresses are different
fields.summary: Allow email address configuration for invitation mail
Add support for skipping comment delivery to the person who caused the action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4733].
  {panel}

We're adding a lot of automation tasks to our support center.

It looks like that the automation list is unsorted, and we're finding that soon we'll have enough rules that it'll be very cumbersome to find a specific rule in order to edit it.

Please add support for:
 -Copy an existing automation task with the ability to save as another name
 -Searching for a specific automation rule
 -Re-Ordering the list of Automation tasks
fields.summary: Copy / Search / Re-Ordering Automation Tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4732].
  {panel}

h3. Description of Problem:

JIRA Server instances that have had JSD in the past may have trouble installing JSD 3.2+  if they ever had JSD in the past and did not go through JSD 3.0/3.1 to complete the necessary upgrade tasks. 

In some cases JSD data is unwanted and can be deleted. For example when JSD was previously installed as a trial.

h3. Suggestion

Add a supported method for removing all JSD data from the instance. 

Use case and suggestion: 
# Customer upgrading from JSD 2.5.9 or under and does not wish to keep any JSD data (JSD was a trial, or any other reason)
#* If desired, customer is able to remove all JSD data so that they can install JSD anytime in the future
# Customer who is currently running JIRA 7.2 and up and is trying to install JSD. Unbeknownst to the customer JSD was installed in earlier version and 3.0/3.1 upgrade tasks were not completed.
#* Customer is able to drop all JSD data so that they can install JSD without having to attempt downgrade. 

Suggesting adding a startup flag that tells JSD to drop all JSD data

h3. Workaround
There is currently no supported workaround. Directly modifying the JIRA database to remove JSD data is not supported.
fields.summary: Add supported method for removing all JSD data from instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4731].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

If the *Add Comments* project permission is removed from the *Service Desk Customer - Portal Access* role, customers sending in emails to comment on their own tickets will instead end up creating a new email with that comment, leading to confusion.

h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce logging into the application logs which inform the user specifically why Issues are being created rather than the original issue being commented, such as:

"Service Desk Customer - Portal Access missing Add Comments project permission, creating issue instead"

Alternatively, if the email can be recognized as being related to an existing issue, reject the email outright with similar logging:

"Service Desk Customer - Portal Access missing Add Comments project permission, skipping..." 

h3. Why this is important
 
While this is not inherently a bug and is intended behavior, there could be improvements in the logging or messaging that is provided to the user, since it isn't necessarily clear that the resulting behavior is that a new issue is created, rather than the email being rejected outright. This could be done in the application logging, or via clearer errors/warnings in the UI project permissions.
fields.summary: Improve logging for when new issues are created when Add Comments project permission is not granted to Service Desk Customer - Portal Access
Interactive Series report in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when SSO is enabled in the instance. Customer list will be under *User Management* > *JIRA Service Desk* > *Portal only customers*. On this view, there is no option to export the users like what is available with the users listed under *User Management* > *Users*

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the same ability to export users on the list of *Portal only customers*

h3. Workaround
You can use the REST API endpoint /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/\{serviceDeskId}/customer as documented in the [JIRA Service Desk REST API reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud] page.

However, since the results list for this endpoint is limited to 50 because of JSD-4186, in case you have more customers associated to a service desk project you can contact Atlassian Support to get the full list of customers.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to export Portal only customers users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4727].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
A sys admin should be able to control whether Agents can invite new customers (hence create new accounts) to their Service Desk

h3. Suggestion
Add a global level configuration (or project level) for sys admins to enable/disable new customer invitation
fields.summary: Ability to disable the "Invite Customers" feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4723].
{panel}
{panel:title=Updated 8 March 2019}
Hi everyone,

It has been a while since the last update so, firstly, thank you for your patience and your ongoing feedback. 

We're looking at addressing this suggestion as part of an upcoming initiative to improve the "create request" flow for Jira Service Desk projects directly in Jira (the portal is not in scope for this). 

We're currently working on designs, so I'll provide another update once we start development.

– Caroline Bartle | Product Manager, Jira Service Desk Cloud
{panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 17 July 2017}
Hi there, 

Thank you for providing input on improvements to JIRA Service Desk.

We recommend that agents add organizations in one of the following ways:
 * To add an organization when you raise a ticket: In the agent view, use the *Raise a request* link in the sidebar to go to the portal and raise a ticket on behalf of the customer ([see documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/raising-requests-on-behalf-of-customers-747602734.html]).
 * To add an organization to an existing ticket: In the agent view, view an issue and update the *Organization* field in the People panel. 

Our original vision was for both customers and agents to create requests from the portal or email, not the agent view. But, from the feedback we've received so far, we understand that this method doesn't work for all teams. To help us improve this experience in the future, we're changing this bug to a feature request so we can continue to gather feedback.

Thanks,

The JIRA Service Desk team
{panel}

h3. 
Summary

The organization field can be added to the Create Screen but once added, it actually doesn't appear in the screen when creating new issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the _Organization_ field to the Create Issue screen of a Service Desk project
 # Try to create an issue via JIRA (not customer portal)

h3. Expected Results
 # The _Organization_ field is visible and can be selected

h3. Actual Results

The field doesn't appear in the screen
h3. Notes

It correctly appears in the Edit Issue scren
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Organization field does not appear in Create Issue screen (not portal)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4722].
  {panel}

Please can you start working on a customisable customer portal?  The current layout is very basic, and can't be properly customised to our branding.  We can only add a logo and change the banner colour.

We currently use Freshdesk, which while we know is serveral years ahead of you in development, is almost completely customisable.  Where they haven't provided some customisation, html code is available to tweak.

I would recommend a similar tab system, of knowledge base and tickets, allowing users to easily self-help and raise tickets, and review their tickets.

As an organisation, we're hoping to move to JIRA Service Desk, as we use all your other products, but in it's current form, it would be taking 10 steps back from the client perspective, with no additional benefit from agent usability.

If this work is in the pipeline, can you tell me when you might be looking to launch your revised customer portal?

Many thanks,

Amber
fields.summary: Improvements to Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4721].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates or shares a ticket with members of their organization, these users(members of the organization) have the ability to remove the organization from the ticket from customer portal.

h5. Feature Request

Looking at the above, may we request that this feature be restricted to the Reporter rather than all members of the organization?
fields.summary: Restrict Remove Organization
Configuring POP mail server error, IOException: Unexpected Response
Provide a text area on each Queue's page
Document the usage of JQL function 'withinCalendarHours'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4713].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
Take Time to Resolution for example, which is an SLA that can be reset:
# Configure a goal that will breach in 1 minute
# Create an issue that follows the goal, wait more than 1 minute, then resolve it for the SLA to breach
# Reopen the issue for the SLA to be reset
# Resolve it within 1 minute for the SLA to be achieved
# Reopen it again and resolve it for the SLA to be achieved again

From the SLA panel:
* The previous statuses of the SLA are recorded, one Breached and one Achieved
* The current SLA status is Achieved
!sla.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Suggestion+
Since the SLA has breached once, the Breached status should be displayed/highlighted instead of the current status.
fields.summary: If an SLA can be reset and has breached at least once, highlight the breached status instead of the current status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4711].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
If the *Administrators role* doesn't have the following required permissions, JIRA Service Desk displays a warning until the permissions are granted. This has also been explained in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolving-permission-scheme-errors-838416389.html].
* Browse Projects
* Administer Projects
* Edit Issues

h3. Suggestion
The Administer Projects permission is necessary but not the _Browse Projects_ and _Edit Issues_ permissions. Please treat this as a minor permission error or a warning and make it dismissable.

h3. Why is this important
Admin will still be able to administer the project even without the _Browse Projects_ and _Edit Issues_ permissions, hence the error message should be changed or dismissable to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: The Administrators role does not necessarily need to have the Browse Projects permission
